definitions.definition: Something designed to fool or swindle.
definitions.example: It was just a trick to say that the house was underpriced.

definitions.definition: A single element of a magician's (or any variety entertainer's) act; a magic trick.
definitions.example: And for my next trick, I will pull a wombat out of a duffel bag.

definitions.definition: An entertaining difficult physical action.
definitions.example: That's a nice skateboard, but can you do any tricks on it?

definitions.definition: An effective, clever or quick way of doing something.
definitions.example: tricks of the trade;  what's the trick of getting this chair to fold up?

definitions.definition: Mischievous or annoying behavior; a prank.
A particular habit or manner; a peculiarity; a trait.
definitions.example: a trick of drumming with the fingers; a trick of frowning

definitions.definition: A knot, braid, or plait of hair.
A sequence in which each player plays a card and a winning play is determined.
definitions.example: I was able to take the second trick with the queen of hearts.

definitions.definition: A sex act, chiefly one performed for payment; an act of prostitution.
A customer to a prostitute.
definitions.example: As the businessman rounded the corner, she thought, "Here comes another trick."

definitions.definition: A daily period of work, especially in shift-based jobs.
A sailor's spell of work at the helm, usually two hours long.
A toy; a trifle; a plaything.
To fool; to cause to believe something untrue; to deceive.
definitions.example: You tried to trick me when you said that house was underpriced.

definitions.definition: To draw (as opposed to blazon - to describe in words).
To dress; to decorate; to adorn fantastically; often followed by up, off, or out.

synonyms: pull the wool over someone's eyes

definitions.definition: Involving trickery or deception.
Able to perform tricks.
Defective or unreliable.
Stylish or cool.
definitions.example: Wow, your new sportscar is so trick.
